main_definition: To perceive sound by the ear.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Understand a spoken statement or message.
meanings_and_examples.example: I heard that our company is merging with another one.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Become aware of something through sound, without intentionally seeking it out.
meanings_and_examples.example: The distant siren was barely audible; I could hear it but couldn't make out the details.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give attention to a person or message by acknowledging them verbally.
meanings_and_examples.example: When you enter a room, please say 'hello' if you don't mind hearing me speak.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of music and performance arts, it refers to an audience member perceiving the sound produced by performers.
meanings_and_examples.example: The crowd was really able to hear every note in the singer's powerful voice during that concert.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To expressly mention something after hearing about it for the first time, often seeking confirmation or clarification.
meanings_and_examples.example: After hearing rumors of a policy change at work, I asked my manager to hear directly from HR.
